intro: Lasiorrhiza eriochlaena, commonly known as the woolly sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage that helps reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish or reddish in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or inland deserts. Due to its adaptations to harsh conditions, it plays an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
